alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Loudon; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 7:10PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Loudon, Knox, south central Anderson, northern McMinn, northwestern Blount, northwestern Monroe and southeastern Roane Counties through 915 PM EST... At 810 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oak Ridge to near Decatur. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Maryville, Athens, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Sweetwater, Loudon, Madisonville and Farragut. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
